materials.raw_text: B: 20 g, Co: 45 g, Ge: 50 g, Tb: 10 g, Y: 20 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store or online chemical supplier; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal supply store; Ge (Germanium powder) - Electronics supplier; Tb (Terbium oxide) - Rare earth supplier; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical supplier.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store or online chemical supplier; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal supply store; Ge (Germanium powder) - Electronics supplier; Tb (Terbium oxide) - Rare earth supplier; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical supplier.

1. Measure out each component using a precision scale. 2. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders for 15 minutes to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out each component using a precision scale. 2. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders for 15 minutes to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a sintering boat. 2. Place the boat in a furnace. 3. Heat the furnace to 1200 째C at a rate of 5 째C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a sintering boat. 2. Place the boat in a furnace. 3. Heat the furnace to 1200 째C at a rate of 5 째C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours.

steps: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the sample to cool down to room temperature naturally within the furnace (approximately 6-8 hours).
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the sample to cool down to room temperature naturally within the furnace (approximately 6-8 hours).

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the furnace. 2. Inspect for any irregularities. 3. If needed, sand down the edges to achieve a smooth finish using fine-grit sandpaper. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant.
